meta.title: COVID-19 | South Winneshiek Community School District

meta.content: COVID-19 | South Winneshiek Community School District

South Winneshiek will provide Voluntary Educational Enrichment Opportunities for our students while school buildings are closed. Student participation is voluntary and no grading or credit is given. Opportunities will be offered as equitably as possible taking into consideration the needs of students; with disabilities, learning English, who lack access to technology including internet or devices for …

div.p: South Winneshiek will provide Voluntary Educational Enrichment Opportunities for our students while school buildings are closed. Student participation is voluntary and no grading or credit is given. Opportunities will be offered as equitably as possible taking into consideration the needs of students; with disabilities, learning English, who lack access to technology including internet or devices for learning. Read more... SW Voluntary Enrichment Opportunity Guidance for Parents

p.strong: South Winneshiek Schools will not be required to make up the time missed due to COVID-19 from March 15 - May 1, 2020.

div.p:
304 S. Webster St.
P.O. Box 430
Calmar, Iowa 52132
Serving the students of Calmar, Festina, Ossian, Spillville, and the surrounding areas in beautiful Northeast Iowa

Regular business hours are
7:30 a.m. - 3:45 p.m.

It is the policy of the South Winneshiek Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. Nor in any of the CTE programs offered (Business, Agriculture, Information Services, Applied Sciences, Health Sciences and Human Services). There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the district’s Equity Coordinator: Kris Einck (563)-562-3269 or email keinck@swinn.k12.ia.us at South Winneshiek Community School District, 304 S Webster Street, Calmar, Iowa.
